localize.text: It’s been quite a while since your first encounter with the Abnormalities.
I should suppose that you have become a bit more familiar with them.
Let me ask you this question again: What do you think Abnormalities are?
Oh please. You can’t still believe that Abnormalities are just bizarre alien creatures that appeared all of a sudden, and that we need to isolate them, do you?
Abnormalities are not the evil monsters that you read about in old fairy tales.
They are not some supernatural gods that descended upon us to judge our sins, either.
There is an old River that has been flowing at the very bottom of the world for many an age.
It is the source of everything, but has been forgotten by mankind.
Nobody knew of its existence, but somewhere in the world there are very small gaps, or holes. It is through those which the river gently finds itself a stream.
For instance, strange beings would sometimes crawl out of such a gap somewhere in the ‘Black Forest’, located in the Outskirts.
Obviously, the amount was simply too insufficient for Lobotomy Corporation’s energy needs.
Our Singularity is not that we produce energy from the Abnormalities.
Rather, it is the ability to create Abnormalities themselves.
Their forms were incomplete because they came from a forgotten place; we were scared of them because they were incomplete. It is because of that terror that they have been sealed underground.
However, Abnormalities are part of the Seed. That’s what I meant by “possibility”.
The Seed is not something that can be made in just a day, or be created on its own.
We realized that if we wanted to fix a broken system, we couldn’t just sit around in a sunny spot, waiting for the clouds to part.
What should we do after planting the seeds, you ask?
We can’t control the entire process, we have to leave them to sprout on their own.
Aren’t we allowed that much hope at least?
